text: The Papal States, officially the State of the Church (, ; ;Frederik de Wit, "Status Ecclesiasticus et Magnus Ducatus Thoscanae" (1700) also ), were a series of territories in the Italian Peninsula under the direct sovereign rule of the Pope, from the 8th century until 1870. By 1861, much of the Papal States' territory had been conquered by the Kingdom of Italy. In 1870, the Pope lost Lazio and Rome and had no physical territory at all, except the Vatican. ==Related pages== * History of Rome * Donation of Constantine * Italian unification ==References== ==Other websites== * Papal States Coinage * WorldStatesmen: Italy * WHKMLA Historical atlas: here the page offering numerous links to maps of/containing Italy Category:Former theocracies Category:Italian states Category:750s establishments Category:Christianity of the Middle Ages Category:Former monarchies in Italy Category:History of Vatican City Category:750 establishments Category:1799 establishments Category:1814 establishments Category:1840s establishments Category:1790s disestablishments Category:1800s disestablishments Category:1840s disestablishments Category:1870s disestablishments
